title: So,  the Targon lore...
body:
Well, on one hand they were pretty well written. Nothing too surprising, but they did what they were supposed to do.

On the other hand, did all three Targon champs REALLY need to have the same basic story? 'They were different from other people. Then they went up the mountain and became godlike.' The only real difference is that Leona and Diana kept their personality, while Panth didn't.

Also: I'm not sure I'm a big fan of Leona becoming more vicious and Diana becoming less. I suppose it's one way of explaining that the sun might not be good and the moon might not be bad, but it's kinda at odds with their in game VO lines. Not that that stopped the Xerath changes, I suppose.

Maybe it's just because all three of them are just more intro stories, but I wasn't too excited about these. 

The Targon information itself was pretty cool. Actual worldbuilding! It's great.

I loved all of it.  It made each of the characters so much more human while at the same time defining them as something much, much greater.  I am very pleased that Riot has abandoned the traditional idea of light = good and night = evil and has instead adopted more of an eastern philosophy of yin and yang, that light and darkness complement each other rather than oppose each other and are part of a greater whole.
I will give you that Pantheon actually appeared to be an actual person, instead of just a walking 300 reference.

I imagine it would go like this:

A: Fight and kill for me, lowly human. 

P: I am no lowly human, I am Pantheon the Aspect of War!

A: Wait, really? You're an Aspect of War? I'm the Avatar of War!

P: Wow, small world. Are you the pinnacle soldier that leads people into battle, too?

A: Yeah! Well kind of. 

P: Explain 

A: Well, I'm not a soldier exactly. Actually I'm just a very old magical race of creatures 

P: By Aurelion Sol, me too! I'm not even a warrior I'm just an old race of aliens that ascended to another plain of existence. 

A: I'm so magical I mind control entire armies just to make them butcher each other. 

P: I'm so magical I don't just mind control I utterly possess soldiers throughout history. 

A: Isn't mind control awesome?

P: I haven't even told you the best part. I control a dragon God!

A: Really? That's awesome. 

P: Yeah, I have this star dragon thing on a leash to do my fighting for me. I figure on a good day I don't even have to fight. I just send this dragon to kill everyone. He can wipe out planets 

A: I am so jealous. Best I've done is a few civilizations. 

P: Well, keep trying. You'll get there someday. 

A: Hey, do you want to grab a few beers? We can tell each other about all the times we got people to kill for us while we didn't really do anything. 

P: That sounds great. Here hold on, I can use my star powers to bring me straight to Gragas's brewery. 

A: Did we just become best friends?

P: Yep!

Pretty good, except maybe the first line. Aatrox moreso appears out of nowhere, supporting the underdog side when their backs are against the wall . He then turns the tide, and after the battle in their bloodthirst they keep going until it wears off and they realize the horror of what they've done. (But history is written by victors, so they try to make time forget).
Eh, true enough. That's why I said 'appeared'.

Yeah its a bit repetetive,but it does give us a lot of possibilities in terms of powers.
Though I hop that one day we'll get a targonian champ who didn't climb to the top,you know a sort of badass normal of the group.
Who do you think will cover the other two slots that are blank? my bet is on Taric as the Earth Aspect.
My bets are Taric and a new champion.

I agree with most of what you said, but I can't bring my self to like any of this champions lore.
Don't get me rong, I really like that they are trying to expand on this department, but I don't think they're doing a 'good' job.

All a get from reading Pantheon's one its "generic anime character". {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
Also, I don't see how a character becoming a heavenly being equals to becoming 'more human' or more relatable.
Pardon my English.
